summary: This is an email chain from December 2020 between US Attorney's Office (SDNY) personnel and law enforcement regarding outstanding case preparation items for the Ghislaine Maxwell trial. It discusses the status of FBI 302 interview reports, notes from witness interviews, technical efforts to access video evidence from Epstein's devices, and attempts to schedule a call with a key witness.

persons.name: Assistant United States Attorney Southern District of New York
persons.context: The sender of the initial email requesting status updates on several outstanding items for the Maxwell case, including 302s, interview notes, video file access, and setting up a call with a witness.

events.title: Indirect contact with key witness
events.description: Law enforcement made indirect contact with a witness who is aware she needs to be spoken to about the case going to trial. She agreed to call after the new year to schedule a phone interview.

events.title: Status update on case preparation
events.description: An email provides updates on the status of FBI 302s, interview notes, CART video file processing, and witness contact.
personsInvolved: Assistant United States Attorney Southern District of New York

keyFacts: The document is internal correspondence from December 2020 regarding preparation for the Ghislaine Maxwell trial.
It references the existence of 'highly confidential items' (images/videos) identified during searches of Jeffrey Epstein's devices.
FBI CART (Computer Analysis Response Team) was attempting to get video files from seized materials to play.
Law enforcement made indirect contact with a key witness who agreed to schedule a call after the new year.
Several FBI 302 interview reports and interview notes from July 2020 onward were still being processed.
